title: Advancing Economic Security for Military and Veteran Spouses, Military Caregivers, and Survivors

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to improve hiring, retention, and career support for military and veteran spouses, caregivers, and survivors, recognizing the unique challenges they face such as frequent moves and caregiving responsibilities. It also expands support for military spouse entrepreneurs, enhances child care access for military families, and improves policies around telework and hiring authorities to better accommodate this community.
potential_concerns: Implementation of new hiring and retention policies may impose additional administrative burdens on federal agencies with limited resources.
Expanding federal hiring preferences could inadvertently reduce job opportunities for non-military spouse applicants.
Efforts to expand telework or relocation support may be challenged by jurisdictional or security constraints abroad and within federal agencies.
Support for military spouse entrepreneurs may not fully mitigate frequent relocation disruptions inherent to military life.
Data collection and reporting requirements could raise privacy concerns or require new systems that take time and resources to develop.
